title: Education Delivery Mode Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for modes by which education programs and course instances are delivered.

terms.label: In-person
terms.definition: Instruction delivered with learners and instructors physically co-located in the same place at scheduled times.

terms.label: Online Synchronous
terms.definition: Instruction delivered online where learners and instructors meet at scheduled times in real time (e.g., live video sessions).

terms.label: Online Asynchronous
terms.definition: Instruction delivered online without a requirement for learners and instructors to be present at the same time, using self-paced materials and activities.

terms.label: Hybrid
terms.definition: Instruction that combines in-person and online components in a planned and integrated way within a single course or program.

terms.label: HyFlex
terms.definition: Instruction where learners can choose among in-person, synchronous online, or asynchronous online participation paths for the same course instance.

terms.label: Experiential or Work-based
terms.definition: Instruction primarily based on workplace learning, field placement, clinical practice, or other experiential settings rather than traditional classroom delivery.

terms.label: Other Delivery Mode
terms.definition: A delivery mode that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed to represent a source system or institution practice.
